titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that the Office of Personnel Management should provide certain vocational rehabilitation services in its administration of the civil service disability retirement program.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

bill.summary: 1/4/1995--Introduced. Declares that it is the sense of the Congress that the Office of Personnel Management should: (1) identify those individuals under the civil service disability retirement program who could benefit from vocational rehabilitation; and (2) advise them of the various vocational rehabilitation programs available to them, including those administered by the U.S. Employment Service and State vocational education divisions.
